Reviews.Title: “Great location, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: rooymans
Reviews.Content: The location is absolutely fantastic and close to "Unter den Linden", Brandenburger Tor and Stadtmitte. There's some nice restaurants in the neighborhood, easy to walk to some main points of interest. But the hotel itself is nothing special and even feels like you've traveled back to the 70s. The TV is ancient, the interior not much more modern. There's not even WiFi anywhere in the hotel. I didn't use any of the hotel facilities and if you use the hotel just to have a place to crash, I assume it's ok for a weekend. Wouldn't want to stay there for a week though.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tarquinius_superbus
Reviews.Content: Spent here for 4 nights here in December; in Berlin for a conference. Great location with a Zara store across the road (yay!). Rooms were OK - not luxurious. Great buffet breakfast. No free wifi which I think is very poor in this day and age. Was Ok for 4 nights and we didn't have a choice anyway - all delegates were booked here - but I probably won't stay here if visiting Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Angelica K
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, this hotel is perfectly located. You are close to some of the major museums, sights, the train station and of course the great shops along Friedrichstrasse. I stayed for several days on a business trip in December when the hotel was very busy with lots of guests and some sort of convention going on. The decor is a little outdated for my taste, but everything was clean and well-maintained. My room was small but very quiet and had everything I needed; the bed was comfortable and I slept well. Breakfast was included in my rate and a real highlight - plenty of choice and clearly a lot of care goes into its preparation. I used the fitness centre, (the machines, not the pool) and while it was adequate I would normally expect a hotel of this size to provide something larger and with more modern equipment. I found the reception staff courteous: they were happy to post my postcards for me when I left for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: hanssterkendries
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located: in Berlin-Mitte, close to Unter der Linden and the Friedrichstrasse station. It's a 8 minutes to the Brandenburg Gate, to the Gendarmenmarkt and to the Museum Island. The hotel has a great concept: it's filled with (contemporary) art and the different restaurants all serve macrobiotic food. The rooms are clean and quite comfortable but they could use a little freshening up. For instance: there is no temperature setting for the air conditioning/heating, the tv is very small and the light switches are completely outdated. Not to the standards of a hotel that offers a turn-over service in the evening... The pillows are a bit thin. That's not a problem for sleeping but it is when you want to read or watch tv before bedtime. Mind you: there a very little non-German channels. Positive on the other hand: the room has more than enough storage room and power sockets. Wifi internet is extremely expensive and so is the minibar. The breakfast is just brilliant! In fact, the second we got up early to spend some extra time in the breakfast room... Name it and they've got it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, rooms a little outdated”
Reviews.Author: capecoraljay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of the city, close to major attractions and very central. I found the reception very considerate and friendly, I was offered an upgrade. The rooms itself are convenient, however not quite up to today's standards. There is no temperature setting for the a/c, all switches are a little clunky and not very slick. The room was well prepared and seemed to be very clean. I slept very well in a comfortable bed. I ordered breakfast in my room which was delivered on time and of excellent quality with plenty of the items I ordered. Overall, a pleasant experience and I will certainly come back. One thing though: It is not customary anymore to have guests pay for internet. It should be offered free.

Reviews.Title: “Solid bargain, great location”
Reviews.Author: amir z
Reviews.Content: The room I got was a tad dated-- a big ol' CRT TV, the bathroom could use some sprucing up along the edges. But otherwise, the price is really good and the location is nothing short of great. For what you pay, you get a solid deal: nice, clean, comfortable, and 5 minutes walk from the Brandenburg gate. Also: the staff is exceptionally helpful and nice. I needed help, and I got it in big chunks with smiles to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location”
Reviews.Author: Shirit_11
Reviews.Content: In the center of former east Berlin,near a train station (Friedrichstrasse). 10 minutes walking to Branderburg gate,lots of restaurants,coffee shops and stores. From Tegel airport (which trains are not running) , take TXL bus which run very often.getting off at the corner of Unter den Linden and Friedrichstrasse and within 3 minutes walking you are in the hotel for the cost of 2.30 Euro. TV are small and old.Great variety in the Buffet breakfast but the cost is 23 euro per person. Free WiFi only in the lobby behind the reception desk with the desk-top computer of the hotel. If you want to use your laptop in the lobby or in the room you have to connect to outside source and give your credit card.Best thing go to starbucks,half block away,have a cup of coffee and use their free WiFi. Bar,restaurant and swiming pool on site. This is my second time in the hotel and i would definitaly come again.

Reviews.Title: “A good conference venue”
Reviews.Author: jbrussellgreen
Reviews.Content: Excellent facilities, conference venue and food. The location was also quite convienient for most of the city centre, just a minutes walk from Unter den Linden

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotel of maritim chain”
Reviews.Author: ZanyB
Reviews.Content: stayed here on business early December. Location is excellent literally yards from Friedrichstarsse station and also from unter den Linden . Hotel is modern and spacious and rooms well appointed for business user with plenty of storage space and comfortable fittings. Some little niggles - there are far too few lifts for the number of guests trying to move round the hotel in early morning, breakfast is good but breakfast room also a bit small for number of guests. Front desk service could be more efficient but in contrast room service is one of swiftest I have known

Reviews.Title: “A little dated”
Reviews.Author: vienna-onthemove
Reviews.Content: Maritim ProArte Berlin is a typical city center hotel from the 90s, built or renovated after the fall of the wall in the former eastern part of Berlin. The location is great, you can walk to a lot of the tourist sights of Berlin from here. The "ProArte" concept is shown by different floors named after well known painers/artists whose works of art are presented in the hallways. Other than that the hotel has a dated flair, the design is typically 90s (fake marble, brass, wood). The main lobby doubles as a pathway of some sort of shopping mall. Food is good (we also had a dinner reception at the hotel), also breakfast was quite extensive. The rooms are OK, size is sufficient, bathrooms well appointed. Workdesk, minibar, etc. All you expect from a business hotel. Design again 90s, but clean and well kept. Staff at reception was friendly. Generally: OK value for money, the greatest plus is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location , great breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Mrsheathershaw
Reviews.Content: We were part of a Riviera tour group that had been moved to this hotel (instead of Maritim Berlin) due to overbooking. We were told we had been upgraded and the rooms were lovely with nice bathrooms and easy to use showers. Linen and towels were clean and beds firm. There was a huge array of food at breakfast to suit every taste including sparkling wine which we did indulge in before a days sighseeing! Also used the pool/spa which was small but as no one else was there it was fine. Staff were always helpful and polite. The only complaints (as such) were the continental pillows (I had to ask for an orthopaedic one that was just bigger) and the room temperature was excessive with no cooling system. It was unseasonally hot for November so slept under a sheet!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Patrick B
Reviews.Content: Great location Helpful staff Nice room with very clean bathroom Allowed 3 of us to share a suite using the sofabed - ideal and made for a cheap stay

Reviews.Title: “Fine location, airy and clean, well worth considering”
Reviews.Author: RedFred1000
Reviews.Content: Abstract painrings and sculptures of the female form differentiate this hotel from others, and enjoyably so. You can love or hate the art, but you can't ignore it! The usual long bedroom corridors are nicely broken up by individual porticoes round each bedroom doorway, and individual lights ovee the doors and behind the room numbers. Not much English language TV mind, just Sky. If there is one thing they could improve, and they need to, it's the amount of space for breakfast. The buffet area is a mighty scrum at peak times - and then you can't find a free table to sit down! Nul points! The trick is to head through to a secondary and quieter bar and breakfast area - ask the way if you can't find it. But seriously guys, the lobby is enormous - could you nick a bit and make more room for brekkie? By evening, the bar area is pleasant and atmospheric for a fine local ale though, so all's well that ends well... Good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: delegate88
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious. Clean and modern hotel. Good location, close to the train station and walking distance to the Brandenburg Gate. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: haras056
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the staff in the Restaurant one evening when my mother tripped over (it was her own fault for not looking where she was going) and allowing me to have a free (Gluten-free) meal which was very nice. The room was very spacious and peaceful during the night unfortunately there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room so we couldn't make a cup of tea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a work conference”
Reviews.Author: KirstScotland
Reviews.Content: The hotel main entrance is on the side street but the address states Friedrichstrasse where the small entrance looks like it leads into a train station. It has an unappealing flashing sign for the bar. That said, once in the main lobby, the hotel feels airy and modern and it is in an ideal area for shopping and sightseeing and caters for many business travellers. The room on the 7th floor (paid a premium) was light and airy. The bathroom was nice although small. We had a drink in the bar which was fine - it doesn't have the feel of a hotel bar, more of a place where shoppers have a drink after a heavy day shopping. The staff were attentive and pleasant. Berlin is not cheap and you will struggle to order a bottle of wine anywhere for less than €30-35. There was a nice selection for breakfast €22 which was a self-serve. There are plenty of places around the corner where you can get pastries and decent coffee for a few euros. The pool area needs a spruce up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with good location!”
Reviews.Author: RuneOslo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, but the germans should wake up and smell the coffee regarding Wifi! It is included everywere else in Europe, but they still charge you a fortune for it in their hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Cherrytree91
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel as it's very easy to walk to many of Berlin's key sights from here and it is also very near the metro. The restaurant is quite expensive for what you get - there are many other good places to eat nearby. Pool area is a little 'tired' I think - needs a bit of TLC! Overall a very convenient and comfortable hotel to stay with very pleasant and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be more convenient!”
Reviews.Author: molacde
Reviews.Content: Neither my brother nor I had ever been to Berlin and wanted to stay somewhere that we could walk everywhere to and that was within easy access of the subway. The Maritim ProArte could not have been in a better place. It's only blocks from the subways, restaurants, and museums. The Brandenburg Gate is ten minutes away and there's a Starbucks across the street. Plus, there were several cell phone stores nearby where we were able to swap out our US SIM cards and get some German ones (to avoid the grotesque roaming fees). The room that we got was small but clean, upscale and comfortable with a nice view. The lobby was large and clean. SERVICE: while we didn't use the services much, the staff was pleasant at check in and check out. No one offered to take our bags up to our room, but I would have turned down that service anyway. VALUE: we paid about $130 per night through Orbitz. this is a super good price, but that low cost comes with a caveat. The room's mini-bar was (as expected) very expensive and used up the whole fridge. There is no free wi-fi. You have to pay for access. And there was no coffee machine. If you want a morning coffee, you have to call room service, or go outside. SLEEP QUALITY: the beds were very comfortable and we slept well, but the pillows were awful. CLEANLINESS: ROOM SERVICE: did not use RESTAURANT: did not use Other: GARAGE: there is a garage attached to the hotel, but parking there is not free. We paid 20-odd euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: p_d_productions
Reviews.Content: Great location near the Fredistrase. Coffee shops and restruants are easy to walk to. I've been in nicer hotels for better rates in Asia, but for downtown Berlin I thought the Maritim proArte was very well price and classy enough. I'd recommend this hotel to anybody who's on a modest budget and wants to stay in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “quite stylish”
Reviews.Author: joe_mavi
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. It's a beautiful building, with plenty of paintings and sculptures (I guess that's why they called it proArte), the rooms are modern and quite elegant, the food is good and the location is also great. It's easy to walk to many places from there and there is an underground station nearby. It a bit of that detached quality of some modern hotels but, overall, it was a pleasant place and I wouldn't have any problems in going back there. The prices may have been a bit on the high side, but the place deserved it (although I haven't had the chance to compare it with similar hotels in the same city)

Reviews.Title: “A great name your own price hotel”
Reviews.Author: chamoloco
Reviews.Content: Used Priceline's "Name your own Price" to get two rooms at the Maritim proArte for 68 US$/night/room for our family of 5. The hotel provided a free cot bed in one of the rooms for our 10 yr old. Hotel has an excellent location. Its vicinity to the Friedrichstrasse train station gives you access to an Edeka supermarket inside the station that is open 7 days per week; there you can get loaded up on drinks and snacks at supermarket prices. Large hotel lobby with bright modern art provides a good setting to relax on one of the many sofas after a long day out (great spot to people watch). The hotel's pool, sauna and steam room also work great to wind down after a long day of sightseeing (specially if you have kids). We did not use the TV so can't comment on the channels. Beds were typical of what you find in German Hotels: two single beds, not the best but they do the job. Don't now about air conditioning in the room since we slept with the windows open as the night were cool. Internet at the hotel is expensive and rather slow but you have a Starbucks that is not even 5 minutes away that offers excellent free WIFI with any purchase. Breakfast buffet at hotel looked very nice but again too expensive for us, so we ate breakfasts at Starbucks, a German bakery or at Dunkin Donuts (all just steps from the hotel on Friedrichstrasse) for a fraction of the cost of the hotel's buffet. Many fun restaurants are located near the Oranienburger Tor tram stop and Kunsthaus Tacheles (about 15/20 minutes easy walk from the hotel - take a left on Friedrichstrasse and walk past the river). BTW many Berlin restaurants are reasonable priced compared to restaurants located elsewhere in Europe (we found most main courses cost around 10 euros), and the meals offered very good size portions too. We had sit down lunch in many places for around 7 euros/person (such as at Dada Falafel - a falafel platter and a drink) If you are able physically, you should rent bikes for one day if the weather is good. You can rent them at the hotel's concierge (they have a few available) but if you have kids, there's a bike rental place that have kids' bikes too and it's a little cheaper than at the hotel ( the bike rental store is left at main entrance and then the first right). BTW If the weather is nice bikes get sold out quickly. With the bikes you can see most of the main Berlin sights very quickly, and there are bike lanes in most streets. It was fun to ride in the Tiergarden past the Prime Minister's residence, towards the part that used to be West Berlin, past ugly Alexandex Platz, and by the parks around the Berlin Cathedral. All of these place are easy to do in a few hours if you're on a bike. Don't miss a visit to Postdam while in Berlin; we took the 12 euro/adult ( kids are free) trip with New Berlin Sandeman's - in addition to the cost of the tour, you'll pay for the cost of the public transport. But this is only suitable for those that can do a lot of walking. BTW Many Berlin visitor's cards offer unlimited public transport travel, but in my humble opinion if you can walk, they are not necessary as most everything to see is within walking distance. For far away places (Postdam or the Olympic stadium) you can just buy singles trips and you will still come way ahead. If you're going to do just one museum don't miss the Pergamon (we walked there from the hotel in about 20 minutes). If the weather is nice, take a boat tour (you can jump on board on left side to the bridge before you cross the river) - again left on Friedrichstrasse as you leave the hotel. The Maritim Proarte hotel is a great base for a Berlin visit if you get a room at a good price and if you stay away from spending money within the hotel's property (internet, mini bar, breakfast buffet costs at the hotel are too high). Get a good room rate and then eat out and you have a great deal in your hands with this Maritim. I rated it 4 star based on the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevensonag
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was living in an art gallery/ museum. Fantastic location just 10-15 mins walk from the Brandenburg Gate and very close to both the mainline railway station and suburban line (access to Airport). Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Location is OK, but the hotel is very worn out”
Reviews.Author: AustrianVisitor
Reviews.Content: The location at the Friedrichstraße is very good. But: the hotel is very old, hasn´t been renovated in ages. The only modern touch is the painting on the walls which have been added recently and explain the name "pro Arte". You may only find bus groups from eastern Europe there. If you can spend a few Euro more, try to avoid it...

Reviews.Title: “Art focussed Hotel - very special”
Reviews.Author: goanto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is closed to the Brandenburgertor and Museum Insel. At the entrance there is an enourmous mall with a lot of paintings and sculptures. Really interesting. The rooms are spacious and contain modern paintings too. Breakfast in Hotel definitely too expencive: they have a buffet with very good quality but it does^'t worth to have it there. They have a pool too. The parking is not for free, you have to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location / Priceline value”
Reviews.Author: pisapie
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget because we were traveling with my husband's father and needed two rooms, so priceline afforded us quality rooms cheaper than the hostels we also considered. This hotel is a newer model, smack dab in the heart of Unter den Linden. It was an easy walk to Museum Island and Brandenburg Gate, and located minutes from the train/subway station, which provided easy access to all points of interest. The rooms were comfortable and good sized for the location. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, high prices”
Reviews.Author: vasilevn
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because of its location and parking availability. The location is really very good - one step away from most Berlin's sights. The hotel looks very good, although the art concept relates only to the paintings in the lobby and the rooms - the building itself does not create big comfort. Breakfast is very good, even perfect - there have selection for every taste. Additional option is the possibility for a dinner buffet. Poor taste leaves only the higher cost of the rooms and the additional payment for breakfast. However, such a location compensate somewhat, especially if you stay short in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: bluesmoon
Reviews.Content: On the whole, this is a good hotel right in the heart of Berlin. It's walking distance from most places and the train station is just a block away. The conference facilities are also good. The big problem with this hotel is the Internet. It's the most expensive internet access I've had to pay for, and it isn't that fast. They also claim to have T-Mobile wifi, but you don't get a signal in your room

Reviews.Title: “Good, solid, conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: LKW9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference, reasonable room rate, room was clean and comfortable although the air conditioning did not do much. The hotel is pleasant and bright with interesting art around the place. Room service was somwhat abrupt and quality of food was not great - a very dry club sandwich with overcooked turkey. Conference facilities were excellent and the location just a short taxi ride from Tegel airport. Overall good for business.

Reviews.Title: “centrally located, artistic”
Reviews.Author: ThanosB-W
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel just in the center of (former East) Berlin within a walking distance from many sights. The rooms are a bit small but the bathroom is new and spacious. There are many modern artwork at the lounge and other area of the hotel. They charge the internet use in reasonable cost. The breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful hotel, great deal”
Reviews.Author: polskajason
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous lobby and hallways. Found a great deal online, about 160 euros a night, including a dinner at the bistro (fantastic!!!) and a cocktail at the bar (also great). The rooms are relatively roomy for business boutique hotels, very modern and clean. The only downside was that you have to get Wifi via T-Mobile's Hotspot service (expensive, unless you're going to be there for a month), but that was more than made up for the 3-course bistro dinner which was otherworldy-good. Service was excellent and friendly, too.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for tourists”
Reviews.Author: JohnKenney
Reviews.Content: Great location for a tour of Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional business hotel”
Reviews.Author: awayweekender
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night so was not able to sample all the hotel had to offer. Checkin staff were friendly and superquick. Room was clean with nice touches - Lindt chocs on pillows (plus a stray one under the pillow) and folded bathrobes on each bed. Toiletries are soso, with two big shower-gel dispensers, one by the washbasin and the other by the bathtub/shower. Shower pressure was good (room was on 9th floor).. you stand in the bath for a shower and draw the shower curtain. Rooms 8th floor upwards are private, however lower floors (on the side I stayed) will face the opposite office building so one would need to draw curtains for privacy. Pool looked good. Got the wake up call I requested at checkin (not something you can take for granted at any hotel). Departed before breakfast time - again checkout was very quick and efficient, and there were plenty of taxis on the stand at 7am. The (very large) bar beside the hotel lobby is lively.. big oval bar in the centre surrounded by soft furnishings. The place easily holds 200 or so guests, and areas can be reserved for groups. People were still being served drinks at 3am on a weeknight. Noise from the bar does not reach the rooms. Security is good with room keys required to activate buttons in the lifts all day long.

Reviews.Title: “The Art Hotel”
Reviews.Author: indiavoyager
Reviews.Content: As the name suggests, the hotel looks more like an Art Gallery!..Well located, the hotel is a short walk from Brandenburg gate, the Dome and other attractions. The service was quite nice and breakfast was sumptuous. Thought they offered internet access in the lobby, but I found it slightly expensive. The hotel has a nice facade is also connected by S Bahn. The staff was courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay at the Maritim Pro Arte”
Reviews.Author: MButler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maritim Pro Arte in early August 2008. It is a beautiful hotel in the heart of Berlin near a major train and U-bahn station. You can take the S-bahn from the airport right to the hotel. It is a two minute walk from the station to the hotel. Likewise you are one station away from the Hauptbahnhof in Berlin. The staff were courteous and helpful at all times. We loved that you could open the windows in the room. The view outside the windows was spectacular. The breakfast buffet was the best we encountered during our 6 city trip. It was not included in in our room price but it still was worth it. Internet is available; however, you must pay extra. The in-room safe was too small for a laptop computer; however, the hotel has larger safety deposit boxes at reception. Just ask the staff and they will make a box available for you. The hotel is just around the corner from the street Unter den Linden. This street leads you to the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag (a 10 minute walk). Make sure you visit the dome at the Reichstag but be prepared for a wait. Also on Unter den Linden is the Opera and its Cafe. The Cafe provides an excellent lunch and supper. Staff at the hotel recommended going to a local restaurant (3 minute walk) called Zur Nolle. Great suggestion and moderately priced. It's right under the train station lines. Take the hop and hop off tour of Berlin. You can catch it around the corner on Unter den Linden. You can purchase tickets form the Concierge. Just be careful to keep your ticket handy if you are checked and be back to your hotel stop before 6 o'clock otherwise you will be dropped off at the nearest stop and then you will have to take the U-bahn back to your hotel. Take a walk on Kurfürstendamm Strasse, the 5th Avenue of Berlin and take a tour of Charlottenburg Castle. Take time to visit the Castle's gardens. Next trip we will go the museums in Berlin. We just ran out of time. Maritim Pro Arte is a little pricey but a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant choice”
Reviews.Author: AgentNikky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in August and was very pleased with my choice of hotel. I went to Berlin in 2004 and stayed at the Crowne Plaza near the Kurfurstenstrasse, although a very nice hotel, it's a bit far if you want to see the historic part rather than the shopping area. The Maritim proarte is in a fantastic location with an entrance on Freidrichstrasse and the main entrance on Dorotheen. A 2 minute walk brings you onto Unter Den Linden with its excellent cafes and bars (Einstein is really good and Nanteck was very nice in the evenings). The Gendarmenmarkt, Willhelm st, Check Point Charlie, Forum Fridericianum, Brandenburg Gate & Reichstag are all a gentle stroll. I managed to get 4 nights for the price of 3 on b&b (lucky travel agent) and believe this was excellent value for money. The room was very comfortable apart from the soft pillow on the bed but we asked housekeeping for more and they promptly delivered so no worries there. The bathroom was clean and bright and the shower quite powerful, there was also a speaker in the bathroom so you could here the TV if you wanted to. The buffett breakfast was one of the best I have seen in a hotel (and I have stayed in many), service was prompt and the selection was vast. They even have a menu card showing the healthy items within the buffett so you could be good if you wanted to. The lobby area is bright with lots of sofas and art pieces on display. The hotel is non smoking. The bar did not open until 5pm which i thought a bit strange for a city hotel but I do think this is due to the many business guests that will be in conference until this time so not really catering for the non business clients. Not to worry because there is a really nice little bar on the next street (Mittlestrasse). Apart from breakfast we didn't eat in the hotel so can not comment on the restaurants, however there was a Bistro, Buffett and full service restaurant within the hotel. Overall I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and will certainly recommend this one to my clients for location, price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FlagstaffMax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maritim pro Arte in Berlin for a week on business. It is very clean, modern and in an excellent location. It is just down the street from the S-Bahn train - Freidrichstrasse Station. It is within walking distance to all the major sights. The staff is courteous, helpful and they speak excellent English. The breakfast buffet is pricey at 20euros but fairly boutiful. There are lots of eating options close by including for coffee-aholics a Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks right down the street. They do not offer free wi-fi you have to pay 15e per day to use the (wired) net from your room. Only one English channel - Skynews. No soaps or shampoos are offered in the bathrooms. However, the towels are plentiful and you get a bathrobe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: C_Scientist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location, within walking distance of Brandenburg gate and the museum island. There are great restaurants and other attractions also close by. Access to public transportation is also very close. It took about 15 minutes to get to and from the Tegel airport (~18 euro fare). The hotel was developed around a very nice idea of putting modern art from different artist all over the hotel and a different artist on every floor. Unfortunately, it is not easy to access floors, room key gives you access to only your floor. The hotel itself has little charm and a few over priced restuarnts. The breakfast buffet in the Gallerie restaurant was good with food options for travelers from the US and Europe. Internet access was 15 euros a night. Rooms were shabby and needed to be refurbished. Liquid handsoap was in the shower with no other common items like shampoo, bar soap, lotion, rooms have no iron. All things you would expect at a Hotel of this prices and one that claims to be for business travelers. Hotel staff were nice but poorly prepared for large crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emilyfed
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location! It was within walking distance of many of the main attractions and museums in Berlin. It is also located very close to public train transportation and many restaurants. The hotel was very clean, safe and stylish. Likewise were the rooms. Great bathrooms by European standards – marble, lots of counter space, a nice tub/shower and even recessed speakers so your don’t miss the details of the game for a bathroom break. The room was also comfortable with windows that opened, stylish décor, a sitting chair, recessed lighting, a desk, TV, minibar, also lots of closet and drawer space. Negatives include very expensive internet – even the local Starbucks right across the street didn’t offer free wifi. Also their gym left something to be desired such as a lack of weight equipment – there were only a few cardio machines. Also the hotel restaurants were over priced. Breakfast in particular. There are many small cafes and breakfast places on the same block for more then half the price. There were only about 1.5 English channels since one was sometimes English and sometimes other languages and they did not have NASN (North American sports network) for those sports fans. As for the beds, we had requested a queen and as often experienced in Europe it was two doubles pushed together. Additionally the pillows and comforters were down with no alternatives available so if you’re allergic you might want to come prepared. Also there is currently construction taking place adjacent to the hotel – which our room faced. However that didn’t pose a problem as they stopped work at night and we were out of the room during the day. Despite the negatives, I would recommend this hotel and this area for those who want to get out and really experience Berlin at its finest. The positives far outweigh and little issues. When on a sightseeing vacation location is everything and this area is absolutely ideal.

Reviews.Title: “The proArte - a cultural experience”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherriff
Reviews.Content: The proArte is a modern, business-oriented hotel with a few twists - particularly a heavy investment in contemporary art, with each floor given a specific theme by an individual artist. I was on the 11th floor, whose theme was 'Homosexuality'. If you are easily offended by the concept, you probably shouldn't visit Berlin, which must be one of the most gay-friendly cities in Europe. However, if you don't want to be reminded as you head for breakfast every morning, you might not want a room on this floor. The 11th is also a smoking floor - I had booked a non-smoking room but arrived quite late and didn't disocver the mistake until I was inside the room. However, it had good airconditioning and was well-cleaned so I decided not to make a big deal out of it. The breakfast was outstanding and the service pretty good - a blown light bulb was promptly replaced. The bathroom was also clean and well-maintained. The biggest downside was probably its proximity to the US embassy and its fortifications, which close off one end of the adjacent street to cars and place pedestrians under some very hostile surveillance. The Russian embassy, in contrast, manages with one sleepy police officer out front. Has to be a moral here somewhere. Overall, the Maritim proArte offers a more interesting experience than the average business hotel and I would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: slmwjMeyer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days in Berlin, with 3 small children. We were pleasantly surprised by our room and the hotel location. I read reviews on this hotel and am very happy we chose it. We had an apartment on the 3rd floor. We had no view, but didn't really care because we were not in there too much. Our room had a small living room and seperate bedroom. The couch folded out to a bed for our 5 and 3 year old, and the hotel provided a crib for our 1 year old. The room was kept very clean, as was the rest of the hotel. They also have an indoor swimming pool. My 5 year old loved it, but it was a bit too cold for Dad and the 3 year old. So, they drank a smoothie from the pool bar and watched. Our biggest mistake was thinking that breakfast was included in our rate... it wasn't. My husband and I were charged 19 Euro a day each, all 3 children were free. Actually, as much as my children ate, we probably came out ahead. I can not imagine what was missing from the breakfast buffet. There were meats, cheeses, breads, fruits, yogurt, cereal, eggs, omelet station, bacon, sausages, and waffles. It was huge and kept pretty well stocked every morning... even when it was very busy. But, just so you know... there is a bakery, a Dunkin Donuts, and a Starbucks right outside of the hotel. I also want to mention a restaurant close by that is well worth stopping in. It is just across Unter den Linden to the right. It's called Pepitos and it is wonderful... try the Pepito special. The location was a great bonus. There is a bus stop 2 minutes outside the hotel and a big train station (Friedrichstrasse) 5 minutes walk.. with an elevator for strollers and wheelchairs. From that station, you can get pretty much anywhere. It is one stop out from the Berlin Hauptbahnhof. I always read these reviews before booking travel, yet this is the first review I have written. This hotel worked out so well for us that I decided it was time to write my own review.

Reviews.Title: “Superrb!”
Reviews.Author: gatototo
Reviews.Content: Not only great for its price and modern facilities, but also very close to the Brandenburg Gate and local transportation. I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morrab
Reviews.Content: Booked in by Martin Randall Tours (London) I found the hotel very convenient for walking in the area of the Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, down the Unter den Linden to the Museum Insel, Berliner Dom etc. The Fredrichstrasse S Bahn railway station is close by, only one stop from the new Berlin main railway station. Altogether a well serviced excellently located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Axeman21
Reviews.Content: Beeing there for two nights during a conference held in that hotel was nice. The breakfast buffet is wonderful, sitting close to the Friedrichstrasse in the morning watching the people in a hurry is great. The food has always been very good, the service staff is polite and nice. The room had a lot of damages at the door, I wouldn't have expected that in a hotel with such a price. Downside was the organisation of the conference regarding the coffee and lunch/dinner breaks. Whenever you try to make a conference there and you have exhibitors keep on watching the hotel doesn't change your plans in making breaks close to the exhibitors. In our case they moved the lunch away from the lobby to the restaurant 1 floor lower than the exhibition and conference rooms. Having that nobody will visit the exhibition... If you just need a good business hotel in a great location where you can walk to the Friedrichstrasse, Unter den Linden, ... it's a good recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elainL
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an excellent location, short walk from the Brandenberg Gate. Rooms are spacious and airy. As this is a new hotel everything is very clean and most importantly it has comfortable beds. Buffet breakfast was excellent with an extensive choice.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: KPP
Reviews.Content: Great Location.Great atmophere. Very Good quality & choice of breakfast buffet. I strongly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Unnickacaso
Reviews.Content: I've been in Berlin for the Real Berlin Marathon and I've stayed in this hotel. Definitely not bad. A modern building, very close to a lot of beautyful places and very conveniently placed near a subway/railway station. My room was big and very clean, the staff was really friendly and did their best to help. I won't be there for this year's marathon, but I hope I won't regret it, because there everything was just perfect and I had a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Maritim Proarte Berlin is a very very modern, comfortable hotel. Located close to teh Brandenburg gate, it's location is perfect to visit all major attractions. Rooms were spacious, clean and very business type. I liked it very much and the price was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: acarlile
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Maritim Pro Arte on a visit to Berlin in December 2003. I really enjoyed the hotel. Rooms were nice, bathrooms were spacious, staff was friendly. There was a delicious buffet breakfast included in the room rate, complete with made to order omlettes as well as all the usual treats. The location is great. It's on friedrichstrasse about a 5 minute walk from unter de linden (sorry -- not a german speaker), and about a 10 minute walk from the brandenburg gate. The friedrichstrasse metro station is also just steps away. Also, a bit of a longer walk is an area called orientburgerstrasse,(?) which had some fun ethnic restaurants and nightlife. The only down sides were that I thought things within the hotel were a bit overpriced. I ordered tea in the cafe one day, and it was 5 euro, which seemed a bit over the top, but maybe that's just how much things cost in that part of town. Also, my sister who lives in Berlin joined me for breakfast one day, and the charge was 25 euro, which again seemed a bit high for me.
